keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets detailing 30-minute inmate checks in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York on August 9, 2019.
The logs are for inmates in 'continuous locked down status,' such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.
Protocol requires staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule, with checks no more than 40 minutes apart.
Each sheet is reviewed and signed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The document does not name any specific inmates or staff members performing the checks, only the reviewing officers.
